Return to t485.org

T485 Developer Portal

The Boy Scout Troop 485 Website is designed with maintainability in mind. This page is aimed at providing new or potential T485 webmasters with information about how to develop and maintain this website.

Table of contents

  • WIP

List of technologies

T485.org uses a mix of web development technologies to increase maintainability and simplify development.

Big web development technologies used

To develop this website, you will need at least a basic understanding of the syntax of these tools.

  • Gulp as a build tool. Gulp provides a wrapper for most of the other tools used.
  • Nunjucks as a templating language. Sections of the website are repeated across pages, and in order to keep these pages uniform and easy to update, as well as to shorten files, we use Nunjucks.
  • TypeScript, a typed superset of javascript, that helps us write scalable, maintainable code.
  • TypeDoc, a documentation generator for typescript.
  • Sass as a CSS Preprocessor. We use scss to develop better, more readable css.
Smaller gulp helpers include

This list is provided just for information, you won't need to understand how any of these work.

  • gulp-terser, which minifies external javascript files, including js generated by typescript.
  • gulp-cssnano, which minifies css, including css generated by sass.
  • gulp-htmlmin, which minifies html, including html generated by nunjucks.
  • gulp-minify-inline, which minifies inline javascript and css from html files, including those generated by nunjucks.
  • gulp-noop, used with gulp-if when nothing is done during the else condition.

Documentation

Documentation is generated for internal typescript files from doc comments, and can be found here.

You can learn doc comments on the typedoc website.
